pageContext.description: Dimensions: EL 47.5mm; W (at upper break) 24mm; EBst 29.8mm; Blp 11mm; Tsep 15.7mm,Typology: longt. furrow in either septum becomes deeper depression at bottom end; off-centered rib running up one septum end; 3 ribs on one face - possibly converging - almost totally removed from reverse face - traces evident; blade angles probably quite crisp before mutilation.,Manufacture: stumps of cg. fl. - including large lump in upper loop angle; add small pits in septums may be cg. defect,Condition: central body fragment - both breaks ancient; stop and fg. crests very battered front fgs and both stops possibly not reduced much - reverse fgs possibly more lost; reverse blade face, outer loop surface, and much of reverse side, mutilated by gouging and filing - dark brown and gold,Attached Material: slight traces of light brown soil; three white grits (?) embedded
pageContext.surface: Palid green to silvery surfaces, much rubbed etc. to brown and gold.
pageContext.site: England, west sussex,worthing,chatham road,40 acres brickfield
